elements.title: National Casket Company (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the National Casket Company made caskets for U.S. president William McKinley and Ol' Rip the Horned Toad (pictured)?

elements.title: Gaku Akazawa (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Olympic wrestler Gaku Akazawa also runs a popular massage parlor?

elements.title: Richard Beale Davis (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Richard Beale Davis first published Chivers' Life of Poe almost 100 years after it was written?

elements.title: Alasan Ann (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that taekwondo practitioner Alasan Ann was injured by a gunshot four months before an Olympic qualification tournament, but recovered in time and won the competition?

elements.title: abortions in Malawi (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that some abortions in Malawi are performed by traditional healers?

elements.title: cuisine of Jerusalem (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the cuisine of Jerusalem reflects a blend of Jewish culinary traditions, including Sephardic, Kurdish, Ashkenazi, as well as Palestinian Arab traditions?

elements.title: Kennedy Blades (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that female wrestler Kennedy Blades once won a state championship against boys?

elements.title: Dead Pony (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Dead Pony renamed themselves after a track expressing how they felt after being told that Santa Claus was fictional?

elements.title: Alex Thach (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Classic Tetris World Champion Alex Thach celebrates victories by dumping Parmesan cheese on his head?
